name: Fieldwork: Claims Management & Legal Billing Audit Program
description: Comprehensive audit program for medical malpractice claims management, focusing on legal billing (counsel fees, experts, depositions), claim mapping, and control testing for duplicates, timeliness, and guideline compliance.

data.label: Scope & Data Collection
data.description: Gather all legal expense invoices submitted by law firms for the audit period.
data.instructions:
# Scope & Data Collection

## Objective
Establish a complete and accurate population of legal expense invoices for the audit period to ensure the audit scope is comprehensive and reliable.

## Prerequisites
- Access to the legal billing system or Accounts Payable (AP) ledger.
- Defined audit period (e.g., Fiscal Year 2023).
- List of active law firms, expert witnesses, and court reporting agencies.

## Procedure
### Step-by-step instructions
1. **Extract Invoice Data**
   - Retrieve all legal-related invoices from the ERP or dedicated legal matter management system.
   - Fields should include: Invoice ID, Date, Amount, Vendor Name, Matter/Claim ID, and Service Description.

2. **Verify Completeness**
   - Reconcile total invoice amounts to the General Ledger (GL) legal expense accounts to ensure no missing data.
   - Cross-check against the vendor master file for any unknown legal service providers.

### Key considerations
- Ensure both defense counsel fees and "ancillary" costs (experts, depositions) are captured.
- Watch for split invoices where one matter is billed across multiple line items.

## Expected Outputs
- [ ] Comprehensive population file (Excel/CSV)
- [ ] GL reconciliation summary
- [ ] List of firms/vendors in scope

## Quality Criteria
- Data integrity verified against financial records.
- No gaps in the chronological invoice sequence for the audit period.

data.label: Claim Validation & Mapping
data.description: Verify invoices map to authorized claims.
data.instructions: Perform a reconciliation between the invoice population and the authorized claims database. Confirm each invoice is linked to an active, authorized case file.

data.label: Duplicate Invoice Testing
data.instructions: Run duplicate testing on invoice number, amount, date, and vendor to identify potential double payments or overlapping services.

data.label: Timeliness of Approval Testing
data.description: Assess the speed of invoice processing.
data.instructions: Calculate the duration between invoice submission and approval/payment. Compare against established service level agreements (SLAs).

data.label: DoA & Escalation Compliance
data.instructions: Confirm that invoices were approved by individuals with the appropriate Delegation of Authority (DOA). Test the escalation process for high-value or complex billing.

data.label: Exception Handling & Resolution
data.description: Review the resolution of flagged exceptions.
data.instructions: Select a sample of billing exceptions (e.g., rejected line items) and audit the resolution process to ensure it follows policy.

data.label: Billing Guidelines Compliance
data.description: Audit compliance with legal billing guidelines.
data.instructions: Review invoices for non-billable items or rate variances according to the established billing guidelines for the medical malpractice practice area.
